description: From thunder +‎ box. Senses 1 and 2 (“portable commode; any lavatory or toilet”) are probably because of the noises that may be made while using it, especially while defecating.

entries.meaning: (slang) A chamber pot enclosed in a box; a portable commode.
examples: Synonyms: (historical) close-stool; see also Thesaurus:chamber pot

entries.meaning: (by extension, chiefly Australia, Britain, slang) Any lavatory or toilet, especially a rudimentary outdoor latrine or toilet, or an outhouse.
(theater) A box of metal balls which is shaken to create a thunder sound effect.

description: Probably a calque of German Donnerbüchse (“(archaic) blunderbuss; cannon”) (from Donner (“thunder”) + Büchse (“box; can; rifle”)), or its etymon Dutch donderbus (“blunderbuss”) (from donder (“thunder”) + bus (“box; container; (chiefly historical) type of early modern firearm”)).

entries.meaning: (military, obsolete) A blunderbuss; also, a cannon.
